column4: This has been troubling me a lot. Ubuntu 12.04 (and the ones before that) was super fast when I first installed it... but over time as I installed more and more softwares, it got slower and slower... it's not unbearable but I miss the fast Ubuntu. I thought this progressive degradation was supposed to happen with Windows only. Do you have familiar experiences?
not reaqlly. if somthing is installed but not running . no extra resources are used except hd space
that should be the case... but I've noticed it everytime!
neo_ Did I install something that slows my computer down?
we dont know what you are installing...
you may need to clarify whats getting slow. and check htop for resource hogs
the application start time gets slow
what software? just load times are longer? the apps still run fine?
yes just the load time... wait, the GIMP healing tool was very very slow
you mean just the load times.. of the apps of os get longer?
yes just the load times.
that points to a hd bottleneck, or hw issue to me. id check dmesg output regullary
I don't know what to look for in the dmesg output.
anything that looks like an error, or hd related
ok I'll try that... but as everything was working fine after a clean install, do you think it is hd bottleneck?
hd may have bad spots near the middle that get used after you start installing.. hard to tell
here's an observation... when my current user account gets very very slow, I sometimes create a new user and it gets a little bit faster (not as a clean install, but faster)
hmm hadn't heard of that... is there some way to not use the bad spots?
i partioned my drive around them as a dirty fix untill i got a new hd.
I have a new hd!
ive had new hds die...
maybe a smaller partition size will help? with all the other partitions not mounted automatically
neo_ btw I have a 64-bit setup
neo_ I don't think this is going to be solved right now :) ...I'll check the dmesg output later and see if there's anything there... Thanks.
